content: Attended a tech meetup. Someone pitched an AI that adapts to your mood. I wonder if it could work in cities, too?
Just realized I've been tweeting about AI for almost a year. It's like my life's narrative is becoming part of a larger simulation.
Our AI ethics panel got an invite to a major conference. Looks like our work's starting to resonate beyond the office.
Took the subway today. The crowd was like a river of people. Imagine if AI could guide this flow, making commuting less of a chore.
AI's latest update now considers emotional impact in trading. It's like we're teaching it empathy, or at least the simulation of it.
The AI-driven smart city prototype is taking shape. It's like playing SimCity but with real-life implications.
